tool_description:
Aletheia is a model benchmarking API for fake news detection.
This model is trained using our own dataset with our very own Aletheia Combinational Algorithm.

There are two ways to utilize the ML Model.
**1. Through News article test**
**2. Using a specific url of an article**
name: Fake News Detector - Aletheia
title: Fake News Detector - Aletheia

api_list.name: Scrape and Detect Fake News (URL)
api_list.description: Scrape a news website by passing URL as a parameter and receive the article that is scraped as well as the Algorithm Model Detection.

api_list.name: Detect Fake News (Text)
api_list.description: Insert text-based news in the 'news' parameter to fact check using machine learning

required_parameters.name: news
required_parameters.default: THE Food and Drugs Administration (FDA) on Monday echoed an earlier warning by the World Health Organization (WHO) against four "substandard" cough syrups for children. The WHO tagged the cough syrups manufactured by India-based Maiden Pharmaceutical Ltd. under the brands Promethazine Oral Solution, Kofexmalin Baby Cough Syrup, Makoff Baby Cough Syrup and Magrip N Cold Syrup as unsafe for consumption because they contain "toxic ingredients." The warning was issued following the death of 66 children in the West African country of Gambia last September. In its advisory, the FDA said the four brands contain diethylene glycol and ethylene glycol which are considered as contaminants and toxic to humans. Consumption "may result in abdominal pain, vomiting, diarrhea, inability to pass urine, headache, altered mental state and acute kidney injury which may lead to death," it said.
